oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ripley, Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: “East Side Looking North, Ripley, Tenn.” Image (partially colorized, part black-and-white) with large mass of people in the middle of the street and to the sides of the street, some horses, some horse-and-carriages, with large sign in the background “Lauderdale for Good Roads,” as well as some stores to the sides – Miller’s Drug Store, Berg N Schafer, others.

“Mrs. I. H. Patton -- 1240 ½ Court Ave. -- Memphis, Tenn. -- Having a lovely time. -- Hope my little Carrie is -- all right now. Bless her -- little heart. Kiss her for me. -- Mr. R. will be out to -- spend Sunday with us. -- Anna Redford”
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Ripley, Tennessee; parades; crowds; towns;
